result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L Stelton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time.
Subject to Work Release.
Consecutive to: 14CM453 and 11CF209.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Any fine/costs not paid during the term of Probation may be reduced to civil judgment.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse L Stelton

CASES: 11CF209, 14CF365, 14CM453 & 14CF469. Defendant Jesse L Stelton in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Jesse L Stelton in custody.  Daniel Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:22 am.  Steffen-not requesting new PSI.  Kemp-not requesting new PSI.  CT grants waiver of new PSI.  14CF469-prelim hearing will not be necessary.  Amended complaint to be filed.  

11CF209-Find elig for CIP & Subs Abuse pgm.  Cannot possess firearm, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or potential loss of other civil rights.  Order 2 yr 6 mo-WST, 1 yr 6 mo IC, ES for 1 yr.  Find 171 days sentence credit.  Follow COMPAS.  PCR.  

14CF365-Count 1 amended to strike repeater.  Amended Information to be filed.  Def-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty. All other counts DRI.
14CF469-Count 1 amended to misd battery w/ repeater-940.19(1).  Amended complaint to be filed.  Def-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty. All other counts DRI.
14CM453-Count 1 with repeater.  Def-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.  All other counts DRI.

SENTENCE:  Find elig for CIP & Subs Abuse pgm.
14CF365-w/h, probation up to 5 yrs, probation may petition for early discharge.  1 yr CT, banked/stayed for use by probation.  $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA sample, no surcharge-find indig.  COMPAS & follow thru w/ recommendations.  No drugs/para.  $860 to Curtis Lundee-restitution.  Cannot possess firearm, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or potential loss of other civil rights.  

14CF469-I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Consec to 14CM453.  Prob up to 1 yr.  No contact with Micah Lerdahl.  $265.60 fine/costs.  

14CM453-Order 2 yr, 1 yr 6 mo IC & 6 mo ES-I&S.  If have to serve, consec to 14CF469.  Elig for CIP & Subst Abuse pgm.  Order 2 yr probation, Restitution $714.79 to Wal-Mart, J&S w/ Haley Eason, Mr Rundquist & Ashley Bottolfson.  Fine/costs-$265.60 payable during probation.  

14CM453 & 14CF469-consecutive to 11CF209 sentence.  All probation concurrent w/ 11CF209.  
Any fine/costs not paid during term of probation may be reduced to civil judgment.  Find no sentence credit. PCR.  11:48 am adj.
Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.
